info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 12:59PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pike County through 130 PM EDT... At 1258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greeley, or 15 miles west of Montague, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lackawaxen, Blooming Grove, Greeley, Pecks Pond, Twin Lakes, Kimbles, Promised Land State Park, Rowland, Westcolang Park and Lords Valley. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 84 between 26 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
